Senior Manager (Capgemini) 
SANJEEV PATIL 
Phone: (+1) 248-692-9724 
Email: patil.sanjev@gmail.com  
https://www.linkedin.com/in/sanjeev-patil-0b27305/ 
"Analytical, ambitious, and experienced professional seeking a senior-level role with applying my expertise in Datawarehousing, 
MDM and Business Intelangence to improve the overall capabilities of the organization's IT systems." 
Profile Summary 
 Total 18 years of experience in Information Technology with a strong knowledge in analysis, design, development, 
administration, implementation of Data warehouse applications( ODS, EDW & Datalake) and MDM Solution using 
Informatica, SAP BODS, Oracle, Teradata, DB2, SQL Server & GCP (Big Query) on Windows, Linux, and HP-UX platforms. 
 Includes 8+ Years of Project Manager, handling Development & Production support projects with proven People 
Management, Financial Management, Stakeholder Management, Consulting, Hiring, Onsite / Offshore delivery model and 
remarkable Client engagement.

Management, Financial Management, Stakeholder Management, Consulting, Hiring, Onsite / Offshore delivery model and 
remarkable Client engagement. 
 Proficient in Design and Implementation of Guidewire Datahub & Infocenter to integrate data from Guidewire source 
systems (Policy, Billing & Claim) and legacy source systems 
 Hands-on experience in SDLC and STLC methodologies like Agile and Waterfall methods. 
 Adept at creating and transforming business requirements into functional requirements and designing business 
models. Solid experience in interviewing business users & internal clients to provide recommendations & resolve 
issues for business problems in multiple project environments 
 Expertise in full software life-cycle implementation, production support, rollout & enhancement from business 
analysis, testing, go-live assistance till post implementation support.

PROJECT: ETL GUIDEWIRE APPLICATIONS AND DATA ANALYTICS 
ROLE:ENGAGENENT LEAD  
CLIENT:NEW YORK SCHOOLS INSURANCE RECIPROCAL, USA  Mar 2023– Till Date 
 
Responsibilities:  
 Governed all aspects of strategic projects, overseeing personnel resources, required products or services, end-to-end 
activities, testing, and ensuring overall successful project launches. 
 Accountable for project quality, timeliness, and adherence to budgetary constraints. 
 Successfully led a global team of over 30 resources, including FTEs, vendors, and contractors, across various functions and 
workstreams, ensuring the achievement of project milestones. 
 Maintained risk logs, action logs, and Root Causes Analyses for tech failures, contributing to proactive problem resolution 
and project efficiency. 
 Support for new application launches and change management and service incidents 
 Plan, Schedule and review fixes for Production Issues, closely working with Change Management.

GW Informatica) and Platform Admin support (Informatica, DataStage, SAP BODS, Logstash, MongoDB, Cognos & Group1)

Responsibilities:  
 As a Devlivery Lead for large engagement which includes 4 Application support & 8 Platform admin support. 
 Work closely with the Delivery team to ensure smooth handover of a release, participate in project design reviews and 
coordination of post-release issues during the warranty period of a release. 
 SPOC for service delivery and responsible for 24 x 7 application support services. 
 Handling all queries, client meeting, critical issues & escalations of client 
 Support for new application launches and change management and service incidents 
 Plan, Schedule and review fixes for Production Issues, closely working with Change Management. 
 Leading technical teams to mentor, motivate and help them to maintain high performance

PROJECT:EDW 
CLIENT:KEMPER INSURANCE, USA 
ROLE:PROJECT LEAD May 2021 – Aug 2021 
 
Summary: EDW Perforance improvement, the objective of the project is to improve the performance of the Informatica batch jobs 
for Claim/Policy/Billing and Quote domain and meet reporting SLA. The data extracted from different source system and load into 
EDW system. 
Responsibilities:  
 Participation in Client Meetings during requirement gathering process. 
 Worked on scope finalization of project and project documents. 
 Worked on performance improvement of 21 informatica claim session as part of scope and delivered within time and 
deployed to production. After changes the claim batch completed in 3.5hrs instead of 8hrs, it’s more that 50% improvement 
in batch timing. 
 Worked on performance improvement of 7 informatica policy session as part of scope and delivered within time and

in batch timing. 
 Worked on performance improvement of 7 informatica policy session as part of scope and delivered within time and 
deployed to production. After changes the policy batch completed in 3hrs instead of 6hrs, it’s more that 50% improvement 
in batch timing.  
 Worked on performance improvement of 5 informatica billing session as part of scope and delivered within time and 
deployed to production. After changes the billing batch completed in 2.5hrs instead of 4hrs.  
 Worked on performance improvement of 7 informatica Quote session as part of scope and development in progress. 
 
Environment: Informatica Power Center, Oracle & SQL Server 
 
ACHIEVEMENT 
• Got appreciation from client on individual performance and on a project level performance 
 
 
PROJECT: TOP3 FICOH AMS 
CLIENT: FICOH INSURANCE, USA 
ROLE:TEAM LEAD Apr 2020 to Apr 2021 
 
Summary: FICOH Guidewire Datahub & Infocenter. A common repository for policy/billing & claim data that is optimized for

CLIENT: FICOH INSURANCE, USA 
ROLE:TEAM LEAD Apr 2020 to Apr 2021 
 
Summary: FICOH Guidewire Datahub & Infocenter. A common repository for policy/billing & claim data that is optimized for 
business usage and it establishes a common language for users that enables faster decision-making and more targeted actions to be 
taken directly in support of Policy Center, Billing Center & Claim Center operations and financial reporting needs.  
 
Responsibilities:  
• Participation in Client Status Meetings & Requirement elaboration Sessions. 
• Understanding functional needs and converting into technical specifications through data analysis  
• Create BODS ETL jobs, Workflow & Dataflow to load data from source to TRF Tables to Datahub and Infocenter tables. 
• Provide planning, document procedures, code version control, setup and maintenance of test environments and code 
migration for project.  
• Worked on commit Roll back process of Guidewire DataHub and InfoCenter.

migration for project.  
• Worked on commit Roll back process of Guidewire DataHub and InfoCenter.  
• Part of production go live planning team, worked on aligning and scheduling tasks for production go live.  
• Experience in Guidewire- DataHub and InfoCenter initial and delta loads.  
• Worked on config files UserETLConfigs. 
• Work with Production Support and other developers in code merge process for Datahub and downstream code to enable 
parallel code development between teams. 
• Troubleshoots environment configuration issues such as BODS Job failures and database related errors. 
Environment: SAP BODS, Guidewire DataHub & Infocenter, Oracle, SQL, Unix. 
 
 
PROJECT: POLICY TRANSFORMATION 
CLIENT: ZURICH NORTH AMERICA INSURANCE, USA  
ROLE: PROJECT LEAD  Feb 2019 to Feb 2020

Summary: Implementing Guidewire Policy Center for Management Liability for a product called Zurich Select Plus and objectives are 
to increase GWP, improve UW Performance & Responsiveness, lowering expense ratio and improve loss ratio for this book of 
business 
 
Responsibilities:  
• Participation in Client Status Meetings & Requirement elaboration Sessions. 
• Understanding functional needs and converting into technical specifications through data analysis  
• Create technical design and aata specification document. 
• Create BODS ETL jobs, Workflow & Dataflow to load data from source to TRF Tables to Datahub tables. 
• Create dataflow to load data from Source TRF table datahub tables using DIAL function. 
• Worked on config files UserETLConfigs. 
• Work with Production Support and other developers in code merge process for Datahub and downstream code to enable 
parallel code development between teams.

• Work with Production Support and other developers in code merge process for Datahub and downstream code to enable 
parallel code development between teams. 
• Troubleshoots environment configuration issues such as BODS Job failures and database related errors. 
• Monitoring and troubleshooting issues in current environment and resolving potential business impacting problems. 
 
Environment: SAP BODS, Guidewire DataHub, Oracle, SQL Server, SQL, Unix. 
 
 
 
PROJECT: DWH GC (Global Custody) 
CLIENT: RBC (Royal Bank of Canada), Luxembourg 
ROLE: Project Lead May 2017 to Jan 2019 
 
Summary: The DWH GC is to store data from various Custody operational systems and to enrich data in order to generate 
internal/external reports and to feed downstream applications. 
  
Responsibilities  
• As an Onshore Project lead, I was responsible for providing the technical solutions using SAP BODS, Business 
Objects reporting & guiding other team members in accomplishing the deliverables

• As an Onshore Project lead, I was responsible for providing the technical solutions using SAP BODS, Business 
Objects reporting & guiding other team members in accomplishing the deliverables 
• Worked closely with client, business users & business analyst for conversion of functional requirement into data 
flow design and technical design document (TDD)  
• Effort estimation, Prioritization of tasks/defects, Raise Business awareness, Onshore-Offshore coordination & 
Quality process Improvement. 
• Actively participated in Code review and user acceptance testing, involved in meetings with end users & business owners 
which helps to deliver the projects on time.  
• Guiding the offshore team functionally/technically for the project deliverables. 
• Worked on Change management and coordinate with multiple team for creating the change request (CR) on 
multiple environment. 
Environment: SAP BODS, SAP BOXi, Oracle, IBM TWS, HP ALM & Erwin, SQL, Unix

multiple environment. 
Environment: SAP BODS, SAP BOXi, Oracle, IBM TWS, HP ALM & Erwin, SQL, Unix 
 
 
PROJECT: EDW, CRM, Prepaid & Postpaid 
CLIENT: T-Mobile, USA 
ROLE: Project Lead Mar 2013 to Apr 2017 
 
Summary:  it’s a AMS project, the data flow between the various heterogeneous sources system with the target Datawarehouse 
system (EDW) which the T-Mobile use as a internal reporting system and also act as a data source system for downstream 
application. 
  
Responsibilities  
• Perform analysis and gathering requirements by coordinating with the Business users.

• Prepare Source to Target mapping documents for ease of ETL implementation. 
• Created and reviewed Informatica mappings, sessions and workflows. 
• Created test data, test scripts, perform testing and review test results. 
• Involved in working with the Business Objects team to create required Universe measures to auto populate values at the report 
level.  
• Prepared release documents for deployment of Informatica mappings, sessions and workflows into test and production 
environment. 
• Responsible for creating Production Packages, need to be deployed every month from TEST and UAT. 
• Responsible for all the production support day to day activities such as monitor the jobs and resolving the issues during data 
load. 
• Responsible for Application Availability and Monitoring support. 
• Provide 24X7 supports to the users and made sure the environment is Highly Available. 
• Responsible for Book close Activities (Monthly, Quarterly & Yearly)

• Provide 24X7 supports to the users and made sure the environment is Highly Available. 
• Responsible for Book close Activities (Monthly, Quarterly & Yearly) 
Environment: Informatica Power Center, Teradata, Oracle, SQL, Unix & Autosys

compelling communications services for people at home, at work and on the move.

PROJECT: Decision Support System (DSS) 
CLIENT: Liberty Mutual, USA 
ROLE: ETL Developer Jul 2005 to Apr 2007 
 
Summary:  Liberty Mutual is one of the leading Insurance business groups in United States of America. The organization has decided 
to build a data warehouse called Subject Area History. Operational Data Store (ODS) is part of Data warehouse. 
  
Responsibilities  
 Prepared Source-Target Mappings documents to provide the logic for mappings development.  
 Designed and developed new mappings using Informatica Power center.  
 Modified the existing mappings to obtain the business requirement as per the client. 
 Implemented real time logic for carrying out incremental load.

 Involved in Performance tuning of mapping, session and SQL tuning. 
 Design test cases for the sessions. 
 Supporting the process and troubleshooting. 
 
Environment: Informatica Power Center,  Oracle, SQL & Unix
